sub_title: Senior Project Officer Humanitarian Disarmament at PAX | Proud Ukrainian | EU fan | ICF ACC coach
summary:
With 7+ years track record in diplomatic institutions, international organizations, civil society and think-tanks, I’m equipped with multifaceted experience in political & conflict analysis, stakeholder relations management, advocacy and communications. Starting from 2023, I am working on international advocacy around environment, climate and conflict issues as part of the PAX's Humanitarian Disarmament team. 

As a graduate of leading European universities in the area of International Relations and EU affairs, I am also passionate about EU foreign policy, Enlargement policy and democracy promotion. I have solid geographic expertise in Ukraine and Eastern Europe, but also a global outlook: I have lived, worked or studied in 6 countries in the EU, wider Europe and North America. Besides this, I am a practicing coach with ACC ICF accreditation and a member of the International Coaching Federation (ICF).

profile_positions.title: Senior Project Officer Humanitarian Disarmament

company.name: German Marshall Fund of the United States

profile_positions.company: German Marshall Fund of the United States
profile_positions.description:
ReThink.CEE fellowship a non-residential policy research program that aims to address the democracy, security, and prosperity challenges in the Central and Eastern European region. 

My policy research project focuses on the future of the EU's Enlargement policy in view of expansion of the list of EU candidate countries to cover also Ukraine and Moldova.
profile_positions.title: ReThink.CEE Policy Research Fellow
Political Officer

profile_positions.description:
Research fellowship focusing on European foreign policy (with an emphasis on the Eastern neighbourhood, particularly, Ukraine, Russia, and Belarus), CFSP/CSDP, transatlantic relations and democracy promotion.

This fellowship programme is managed by the CER jointly with the Brookings Institution (the Centre for the United States and Europe), Cambridge University (the Department of Politics and International Studies), King’s College London (the Department of European & International Studies).
profile_positions.title: Clara Marina O’Donnell fellow
Researcher
Political Advisor

profile_positions.description:
The Reanimation Package of Reforms is the largest civil society coalition in Ukraine that works as coordination centre for 81 leading NGOs which have pooled their efforts to facilitate and implement reforms.
As the International Relations Manager, I was in charge of advocating and communicating reform developments to Ukraine's international partners (international institutions, diplomatic corps and officials), which included:
- preparing regular reform updates and analytical materials to over 1200 high-profile contacts from 30 embassies, 20 international organizations and other international institutions, 
- organizing several dozens of diplomatic breakfasts and other events dedicated to reforms for international stakeholders:
- coordinating the RPR experts' participation  in the meetings with representatives of international institutions; 
- providing arrangements for international advocacy visits of RPR delegations to key European capitals;
- carrying out projects aimed at discussing international best practices in implementing reforms (e.g. #UkraineReforms project with Martens Center for European Studies, a unique week-long Ukrainian Reform Study Trip to Kyiv for activists from Central Asia, South Caucasus and Eastern Europe in partnership with Prague Civil Society Centre, other projects with Embassies and foreign NGOs).
profile_positions.title: International Relations Manager
Parliamentary intern

company.name: The Hague Centre for Strategic Studies (HCSS)

profile_positions.company: HCSS - The Hague Centre for Strategic Studies
profile_positions.description:
The "Multilingual Metafore" study is a part of the annual Strategic Monitoring project, conducted by the HCSS to create an overview of how leading experts/sources in the Russian, Chinese, Turkish, Arabic and Persian (Farsi) 'language domains', perceive the contemporary and the future security environment; to identify key risks to international security and the drivers of these risks (from both governmental and non-governmental perspectives). 
Participation in the Metaforesight Study implied following tasks: collecting and coding foresights; generating visuals; writing-up the final research product.
profile_positions.title: Remote Research Assistant
Project Assistant

company.name: German Marshall Fund of the United States
